channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: 'It was silly from me' - 'brilliant' Delap recovers from error
item.description: Chelsea striker Liam Delap turns in "top" performance in the 4-0 win over Hull City with a hat-trick of assists after missing a sitter.

item.title: 'Intense, aggressive, entertaining' - what will Tudor bring to Spurs?
item.description: After Igor Tudor agrees to take charge of Tottenham for the remainder of the season, BBC Sport takes a look at what supporters can expect to see from his side.

item.title: 'Marvellous' Man City set WSL standard in rampant win
item.description: 'Marvellous' Manchester City set WSL standard in rampant 6-0 win over bottom side Leicester.

item.title: 'Greedy' Wrexham dream of adding to 'incredible journey'
item.description: Wrexham are dreaming of adding to their "incredible journey" after reaching the FA Cup fifth round for the first time in 29 years with victory over Ipswich Town.

item.title: Neto scores hat-trick as Chelsea see off Hull in FA Cup
item.description: A Pedro Neto hat-trick fires Chelsea through to the FA Cup fifth round with a comfortable win at Championship Hull City.

item.title: Wrexham beat Ipswich to progress to FA Cup fifth round
item.description: Wrexham book their place in the fifth round of the FA Cup for the first time in 29 years as they beat Championship rivals Ipswich Town at Stok Cae Ras.

item.title: Discriminatory chants called 'stain on game' after arrests made at Hull City
item.description: Arrests have been made following incidents of alleged discriminatory chanting during the FA Cup fourth round match between Hull City and Chelsea.

item.title: Pereira signs deal as Forest boss until end of next season
item.description: Vitor Pereira has signed a deal until the end of next season to become Nottingham Forest's fourth manager of the campaign.

item.title: One manager, two jobs - how will O'Neill's situation work?
item.description: After the announcement that he will manage both Northern Ireland and Blackburn Rovers this season, how will Michael O'Neill juggle two jobs?

item.title: Man cave and fatherhood - Elanga on life at Newcastle
item.description: Why Anthony Elanga is loving his time at Newcastle following his £55m move from Nottingham Forest in the summer.

item.title: 'What on earth is he doing?!' - Delap misses big chance for Cheslea
item.description: Liam Delap misses a huge chance to give Chelsea the lead against Hull City in their FA Cup fourth round tie at the MKM Stadium.

item.title: 'We have a lot of work to do' - Guardiola on Ratcliffe's comments
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says we will "have a better society" by embracing other cultures but the world has "a lot of work to do".

item.title: Watch: Paton lob seals St Johnstone win at Airdrie
item.description: Watch Ruari Paton's solitary goal in St Johnstone's win at Airdrieonians, which moved the Perth side five points clear at the top of the Scottish Championship.

item.title: Arsenal miss chance to restore six-point lead in Brentford draw
item.description: Arsenal miss out on the chance to restore their six-point lead at the top of the Premier League in a thrilling 1-1 draw at Brentford.

item.title: To boo or not to boo? Pundits and fans have their say
item.description: Football fans and BBC pundits Danny Murphy, Joe Hart and Wayne Rooney have their say on whether it is OK to boo your own team.

item.title: Man City, Chelsea & Bayern eye Thiago - Saturday's gossip
item.description: Man City, Chelsea and Bayern Munich retain Igor Thiago interest, Dayot Upamecano dashes Real Madrid & Liverpool hopes, while Real Madrid place Endrick off limits, plus more.

item.title: Africa Cup of Nations 2027 set for June-July slot
item.description: Afcon 2027 will be held in June and July next year and reports the finals could be delayed are "totally unfounded", says African football boss Patrice Motsepe.

item.title: Sutton's FA Cup fourth-round predictions v Daffy Duck & Porky Pig
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Daffy Duck and Porky Pig - and AI - with his predictions for all 16 FA Cup fourth-round ties.

item.title: Man City's Rodri charged over 'not fair' referee comments
item.description: Manchester City midfielder Rodri is charged with misconduct by the Football Association following comments he made about referees following his side's 2-2 draw with Tottenham earlier this month.

item.title: 'I had to put everyone on edge' - how managers make an impact
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains the key things a manager can do before, during and after matches to get the results they want.

item.title: Rangers v Hearts, Oxlade-Chamberlain and Goodwin in focus
item.description: Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts travel to Ibrox in the game of the weekend, while Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain and Jim Goodwin are also in focus

item.title: Better society if we 'embrace other cultures' - Guardiola
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says we will "have a better society" by embracing other cultures, in response to Sir Jim Ratcliffe's immigration remarks.

item.title: Tudor agrees deal to become Spurs' interim boss
item.description: Igor Tudor agrees a deal to become Tottenham interim head coach until the end of the season.

item.title: Football must avoid 'microscopic' VAR - Uefa refs' chief
item.description: Uefa referees' chief Roberto Rosetti says video assistant review (VAR) is becoming too forensic and handball must be revisited.

item.title: Celtic report £13.2m pre-tax interim profit
item.description: Celtic report a pre-tax profit of £13.2m in their interim results for the six months to December.

item.title: Can you name all FA Cup finalists since 2008 that weren't the 'big six'?
item.description: With the FA Cup returning this weekend, test your knowledge of the previous finalists from outside the Premier League's 'big six'.

item.title: New faces, chasers and strugglers - what to look out for in the EFL
item.description: BBC Sport highlights five things to look out for in Saturday's EFL schedule.

item.title: Guehi and Glasner 'had big disagreement' during defeat by Macclesfield
item.description: Macclesfield assistant manager Francis Jeffers tells The Wayne Rooney Show Oliver Glasner and Marc Guehi had a "big disagreement" at half-time in Crystal Palace's FA Cup third-round defeat by the non-league side.

item.title: Hull will always have a special place in my heart - Rosenior
item.description: Chelsea manager Liam Rosenior sits down with BBC Sport before Friday night's FA Cup fourth-round clash with Hull City - a team he used to both play for and manage.

item.title: Andrews praises 'sensational' Brentford after Arsenal draw
item.description: Brentford manager Keith Andrews feels his side outperformed Arsenal in the second half of their 1-1 draw at the GTech Community Stadium in the Premier League.

item.title: Arsenal let game become chaotic - Arteta
item.description: Mikel Arteta says his side lacked discipline and composure in the second half, as Arsenal have to settle for a 1-1 draw away at Brentford in the Premier League.

item.title: How 'terrific' Wirtz shone for Liverpool
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy says Florian Wirtz was "pulling the strings" for Liverpool in their 1-0 against Sunderland.

item.title: To boo, or not to boo? Do players notice and why do fans do it?
item.description: Booing at football is an accepted part of the game. It's been around since time began, but are fans increasingly booing their own team?

item.title: One of big strengths in squad - Slegers on Smith's new role
item.description: Arsenal boss Renee Slegers praises the versatility of forward Olivia Smith before Sunday's trip to Brighton in the Women's Super League.

item.title: How poker-face Eustace has transformed Derby in year
item.description: Derby County head coach John Eustace reflects on his first year in the job and looks ahead to what he wants from the Rams.

item.title: Will Arsenal's end-of-season form haunt them again?
item.description: Arsenal are four points clear at the top of the Premier League with 12 games to play - but will recent history repeat itself?

item.title: O'Neill to juggle Blackburn & Northern Ireland roles
item.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill is appointed Blackburn Rovers boss until the end of the season in a move that will see him juggle both roles.

item.title: Pato consortium pulls out of Colchester talks
item.description: An investment group including former AC Milan and Brazil forward Alexandre Pato withdraws from talks to take over Colchester United.

item.title: Rangers out to apply pressure as Hearts aim to 'annoy'
item.description: Rangers and Heart of Midlothian both deny Sunday's meeting is a "must-win" game, but both know the stakes are high in the Scottish Premiership title race.

item.title: Should Foden have been sent off against Fulham?
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy believes Manchester City's Phil Foden was "lucky" not to have been sent off for a tackle on Fulham's Calvin Bassey.

item.title: Van Dijk scores as Liverpool beat Sunderland to close top-four gap
item.description: Virgil van Dijk's header gives Liverpool a 1-0 victory over Sunderland, as Arne Slot's side become the first away team to win at the Stadium of Light in the Premier League this season.

item.title: Haaland ends open-play goal drought as Man City beat Fulham
item.description: Erling Haaland scores his first goal from open play in the Premier League in nine games, as Manchester City soundly defeat Fulham 3-0 to move three points behind league leaders Arsenal.

item.title: Burnley score three quickfire goals to stun Palace in comeback win
item.description: Burnley score three goals in seven minutes as Scott Parker's side come from 2-0 down to beat Crystal Palace 3-2 at Selhurst Park in the Premier League.

item.title: Late own goal helps Aston Villa beat Brighton
item.description: A late Jack Hinshelwood own goal gives Aston Villa a 1-0 win over Brighton, in a game where their former midfielder James Milner equals the all-time Premier League appearance record.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: Docherty to assist as Aberdeen prepare for summer appointment
item.description: Former assistant manager Tony Docherty rejoins Aberdeen to strengthen Peter Leven's interim management team until the summer as the Scottish Premiership club prepare to wait until then for a new head coach.

item.title: BBC to show Scots' games live as Serie A returns to free-to-air TV
item.description: Games involving Scotland internationals Scott McTominay, Billy Gilmour, Lewis Ferguson, Che Adams, Lennon Miller, Kieron Bowie and Josh Doig are to be shown live on the BBC from Sunday thanks to a new multi-game rights package.

item.title: 'Pep also loves golf and wanted to know what my handicap was'
item.description: Ex-cricketer Nick Knight's nephew Ben once played for Pep Guardiola at Manchester City - now January's League Two player of the month wants promotion with Cambridge.

item.title: Le Tissier & Terland's celebration mocks Man Utd fan
item.description: Manchester United's Elisabeth Terland and Maya Le Tissier playfully mock Frank Ilett by pretending to cut their hair while celebrating a goal.

item.title: Port Vale v Bristol City FA Cup tie postponed
item.description: Saturday's FA Cup fourth-round tie between Port Vale and Bristol City is postponed because of a waterlogged pitch.

item.title: Bellamy aims high after Wales' Nations League draw
item.description: Wales are grouped with champions Portugal, Denmark and Norway in the top tier of the Nations League.

item.title: Wasteful Forest held at home by Wolves
item.description: Nottingham Forest play out a frustrating 0-0 home draw with bottom side Wolves despite having 35 attempts at goal, the most by a Sean Dyche side in the Premier League.

item.title: Frank dismissal needed as Spurs in danger of relegation - Shearer
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer believes Tottenham had no choice but to sack manager Thomas Frank as the club are currently in a relegation battle.

item.title: Watch Dyche's final interview as Forest boss
item.description: Watch Sean Dyche's final interview as Nottingham Forest boss after their 0-0 draw with bottom side Wolverhampton Wanderers.

item.title: Liverpool showed 'character' to win at Sunderland - Slot
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says his team showed "character" to beat Sunderland 1-0 at the Stadium of Light.

item.title: 'This has turned a bit personal' - Confession Cam
item.description: WSL presenter Alex Scott and pundits and fellow Lionesses legends Fara Williams, Ellen White and Steph Houghton make confessions about each other, and reveal who they would sign, bench and sell in a five-a-side team.

item.title: Frank's downfall: Inside his struggle to get players and fans onboard
item.description: Thomas Frank has been sacked as Tottenham manager after just eight months in charge. BBC Sport's Sami Mokbel takes a closer look at his tenure.

item.title: Why Frank at Tottenham was a gamble that ended in bitter failure
item.description: Thomas Frank's sacking came as no surprise on Wednesday. His appointment by Tottenham was a gamble that ended in a storm of toxicity, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Carrick's 'Sir Alex' playbook and a happy start at Man Utd
item.description: Michael Carrick is happy with his start as Manchester United head coach despite dropping his first points in 1-1 draw at West Ham.

item.title: Can you name the past 10 permanent Spurs managers?
item.description: Thomas Frank has been sacked by Tottenham after just under eight months in charge - can you name the managers who came before him?

item.title: Why are Aberdeen taking so long to appoint a manager?
item.description: The club are still working to find Jimmy Thelin's successor, a month after the Swede's exit.

item.title: All February's done deals, including deadline day, in one place
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: How does the Nations League work and when is the draw?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains how the Uefa Nations League works ahead of the draw for the 2026-27 competition

item.title: What do you get for winning EFL Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the winner of the Carabao Cup gets.

item.title: When is transfer deadline day around the world?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when the transfer deadline is set around the world.

item.title: How many players are clubs allowed to loan out?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain the rules around how many players clubs are allowed to send out on loan

item.title: What happens during a football medical?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain what is involved in a medical exam when a football player joins a new club.

item.title: What is a transfer deal sheet?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at what a transfer deal sheet is and why it is needed for transfers on deadline day.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: Cologne youth team break record with 50,000 crowd
item.description: Cologne's Under-19s break the attendance record for a Uefa Youth League match with 50,000 people watching the side take on Inter Milan.

item.title: Ex-Villa striker Duran signs for sixth club aged 22
item.description: Former Aston Villa striker Jhon Duran joins the sixth club of his career at the age of just 22 as he signs for Zenit St Petersburg on loan.

item.title: Why are Real Madrid players training in masks?
item.description: Real Madrid players have been pictured taking part in high-intensity drills while wearing unusual blue masks - so what's the reason for them?

item.title: Booed by some, loved by others - why does Vinicius divide Real fans?
item.description: Despite scoring a vital goal against Rayo Vallecano, why does forward Vinicius Jr continue to split opinion at the Bernabeu?

item.title: Quiz: Name the record transfer for every letter of the alphabet
item.description: When it comes to transfer windows, it's not all about the numbers - the letters are important too!

item.title: Bompastor keeps reason for Green's Chelsea exit 'private'
item.description: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor says she wants Paul Green's exit as head of women's football after 13 years kept "private and confidential".

item.title: How Aluko sparked women's football punditry debate
item.description: How former England foward Eni Aluko sparked a women's football punditry debate.

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.
